duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide comprehensive ongoing assessment of safety and risk to families involved in ongoing child welfare cases.
Implement and monitor appropriate services to focus on family preservation and family reunification if a child has been removed from the home.
Conduct face-to-face visits with the family on at least a monthly basis.
Coordinate information-sharing and communication with stakeholders and collaterals throughout the duration of the case.

Engage families in creating effective treatment plans that address safety and risk factors, focusing on permanency and permanent connections for families and children involved in ongoing child welfare cases.
Utilize data to inform family outcomes and evaluate practice with families.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university required in social work or human behavioral sciences. A Master's degree in one of the human behavioral science fields preferred.
